definitions.definition: having had the kind of education mentioned; having been to the school, college or university mentioned

examples.text: They were poorly educated and spoke little English.
Less formally educated people can acquire professional competence.
the need for a broadly educated workforce

definitions.definition: having had a high standard of education; showing a high standard of education

examples.text: **Less educated** people are missing out on these opportunities.
This is sometimes seen as the newspaper for an educated elite.
She's an educated and articulate spokeswoman.
He spoke in an educated voice.
Educated people might see through these claims.
a study conducted among educated women living in Mumbai
It is the best-educated workforce in Europe.

definitions.definition: a guess that is based on some degree of knowledge, and is therefore likely to be correct

examples.text: As a vet, he could make an educated guess as to what was wrong with his stomach.
She could make an educated guess as to what was wrong with him.
